docs.lead_paragraph: Bernie Sanders acknowledged on Saturday that he'd lose the Democratic primary to Hillary Rodham Clinton if the election were held now.

headline.print_headline: Sanders Allows He'd Lose Democratic Primary if Held Today

docs.lead_paragraph: At a time when liberals are ascendant in the party, some Democrats believe Hillary Rodham Clinton’s time representing Wall Street as a senator could become a vulnerability.

byline.contributor: Amy Chozick contributed reporting from North Charleston, S.C.

docs.snippet: At a time when liberals are ascendant in the party, some Democrats believe Hillary Rodham Clinton’s time representing Wall Street as a senator could become a vulnerability....
docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton's past work on behalf of Wall Street banks has become liability for her during 2016 presidential campaign, with many in Democratic party believing she would be too soft on industry that has fallen into deep disfavor; Clinton still leads in polls but issue could harm enthusiasm among party base if she is nominated.

headline.print_headline: Clinton Battles Image of Being Soft on Wall St.
headline.main: Wall St. Ties Linger as Image Issue for Hillary Clinton

docs.lead_paragraph: Former President Kim Young-sam, who formally ended decades of military rule in South Korea and accepted a massive international bailout during the 1997-1998 Asian financial crisis, died Sunday. He was 87.

headline.print_headline: Former South Korean President Kim Young-Sam Dies at Age 87
headline.main: Former South Korean President Kim Young-Sam Dies at Age 87

docs.lead_paragraph: A member of Al Qaeda said the attack on the Radisson Blu Hotel in Bamako was carried out by a jihadist group loyal to Mokhtar Belmokhtar, a Qaeda operative.

byline.contributor: Liam Stack and Amy Chozick contributed reporting.
byline.original: By RUKMINI CALLIMACHI and NABIH BULOS

docs.snippet: A member of Al Qaeda said the attack on the Radisson Blu Hotel in Bamako was carried out by a jihadist group loyal to Mokhtar Belmokhtar, a Qaeda operative....
docs.abstract: Al Qaeda member confirms that attack on Radison Blu Hotel in Mali, killing 19, was carried out by Jihadist group loyal to Algerian operative  Mokhtar Belmokhtar; analysts view terror attacks by Al Qaeda as attempt to assert group's position against rising Islamic State in quest to gain supremacy among jihadists on global scale.

headline.print_headline: Attackers at Hotel Are Linked to an Algerian Qaeda Leader
headline.main: Mali Hotel Attackers Are Tied to an Algerian Qaeda Leader

docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton proposed a tax credit for those who face excessive and unexpected health care costs, the first part of multipronged approach to tax relief to be unveiled in the coming days, according to her campaign....

docs.lead_paragraph: After several days of pressure, Mayor David Bowers said he was wrong to say the World War II-era camps were justified.
docs.snippet: After several days of pressure, Mayor David Bowers said he was wrong to say the World War II-era camps were justified....
docs.abstract: Roanoke, Va, Mayor David Bowers apologizes for comments equating his support for halting Syrian refugee assistance with need to sequester Japanese in internment camps during World War II; internment of Japanese is now generally considered one of worst human rights violations committed by American government.

headline.print_headline: In Virginia, Mayor Sorry for Remarks on Refugees
headline.main: Roanoke Mayor Apologizes for Japanese Internment Remarks
